bibl.title: Letter from Sidney R. Simon to Henry Rose Carter, June 26, 1919

div1.p: Simon inform Carter that he will publish his yellow fever paper from the Atlantic City, New Jersey symposium.

div1.head: Letter from Sidney R. Simon to Henry Rose Carter, June 26, 1919
div1.opener:
Misc
Y. F-
THE AMERICAN SOCIETY OF TROPICAL MEDICINE
457 PARK AVENUE,
ROCHESTER, N. Y., U. S. A.
New Orleans, La.
June 26, 1919.
OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY AND TREASURER
JOHN M. SWAN, M. D.
Dr. H.R. Carter, Asst. Surgeon Gen., U.S.P.H.S.,
Baltimore, Maryland.
My Dear Dr. Carter:-
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of June 20th, and
was pleased to hear from you.

The Mss. of your paper read at the Atlantic City
meeting is to be sent to me. The Society has made arrangements
with the New Orleans Medical & Surgical Journal to publish
the transaction for the coming year. At the end of this time,
it is the intention to make an entirely new arrangement. Before
the convening of the next meeting, I shall write to a few
of the prominent members of the Society, like yourself, and
get an expression of opinion as to the best future procedure.
I am trying to arrange to have this years transactions printed
in bound copy within the next few months.

Any suggestions that occur to you for the betterment
of our work during the year will be most thankfully received.
